intro: Scelochilus latipetalus, commonly known as the broad-petaled scelochilus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive silvery underside that adds to its ornamental value. Scelochilus latipetalus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
